nodes.text: An IoT based system using Node MCU, Arduino and Wi-Fi can provide integrated smart security and smart home automation that overcomes range and reliability drawbacks of existing short-range methods
The proposed system addresses two complementary problems: home security (intruder detection and alert) and home automation (remote control of appliances)
System is implemented using Node MCU as primary controller, Arduino UNO for the camera, and sensors (IR, DHT11, MQ135), relays and OV7670 camera; results are viewable on a smartphone app
When motion is detected by the IR sensor the camera captures an image which is stored on a PC and an alert image is sent to the owner by email
Users can remotely control lights and fans over the Internet from a smartphone; if Wi-Fi is unavailable the system can operate over 3G or 4G
Environmental sensors (DHT11 and MQ135) provide per-second humidity, temperature and air quality readings to the smartphone for environment monitoring
Camera module (OV7670) is connected to Arduino UNO rather than Node MCU because Node MCU provides only one analog input and camera requires more pins
Prototype supports three operating modes: smart security (intruder alert and owner actions), smart home automation (remote appliance control), and environment monitoring
Captured OV7670 images are stored in a PC folder and delivered to the predefined user email address when motion is detected
Prototype outputs and sensor/camera results can be viewed through the Blink smartphone app
The system is low cost, enables long distance device control, is time saving, and beneficial for handicapped and elderly users
The system depends on Internet connectivity to function (IoT devices require internet access), representing an operational limitation
The design can be extended or reimplemented using alternative platforms such as Raspberry Pi
